intro: Pavonia meeboldii, commonly known as the yellow bluemont, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Pavonia meeboldii is often found in open habitats and can thrive in partial shade to full sun.
